diff --git a/home/fernanda/mnt/fernanda/git-styler/styler/python/experiments/results/couchbase-couchbase-java-client/errored/1/22/ByteArrayDocument.java b/home/fernanda/mnt/fernanda/git-styler/styler/python/experiments/results/couchbase-couchbase-java-client/intellij/22/ByteArrayDocument.java index 20413c04a81..3a080495666 100644 --- a/home/fernanda/mnt/fernanda/git-styler/styler/python/experiments/results/couchbase-couchbase-java-client/errored/1/22/ByteArrayDocument.java +++ b/home/fernanda/mnt/fernanda/git-styler/styler/python/experiments/results/couchbase-couchbase-java-client/intellij/22/ByteArrayDocument.java @@ -13,6 +13,7 @@ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and * limitations under the License. */ + package com.couchbase.client.java.document; import com.couchbase.client.core.message.kv.MutationToken; @@ -24,7 +25,7 @@ import java.io.Serializable; /** * Handles a byte array as the document value. - * + *

* This document differs from {@link BinaryDocument} in that there is no manual refcounting needed on the * underlying buffers. As a result, it is much safer to work with than the traditional {@link BinaryDocument} * and should be preferred as a result. Note that the cost is a single byte array copy from the buffer, so if this @@ -50,7 +51,7 @@ public class ByteArrayDocument extends AbstractDocument implements Seria /** * Creates a {@link ByteArrayDocument} which the document id and content. * - * @param id the per-bucket unique document id. + * @param id the per-bucket unique document id. * @param content the content of the document. * @return a {@link ByteArrayDocument}. */ @@ -61,9 +62,9 @@ public class ByteArrayDocument extends AbstractDocument implements Seria /** * Creates a {@link ByteArrayDocument} which the document id, content and the CAS value. * - * @param id the per-bucket unique document id. + * @param id the per-bucket unique document id. * @param content the content of the document. - * @param cas the CAS (compare and swap) value for optimistic concurrency. + * @param cas the CAS (compare and swap) value for optimistic concurrency. * @return a {@link ByteArrayDocument}. */ public static ByteArrayDocument create(String id, byte[] content, long cas) { @@ -73,9 +74,9 @@ public class ByteArrayDocument extends AbstractDocument implements Seria /** * Creates a {@link ByteArrayDocument} which the document id, content and the expiration time. * - * @param id the per-bucket unique document id. + * @param id the per-bucket unique document id. * @param content the content of the document. - * @param expiry the expiration time of the document. + * @param expiry the expiration time of the document. * @return a {@link ByteArrayDocument}. */ public static ByteArrayDocument create(String id, int expiry, byte[] content) { @@ -84,15 +85,15 @@ public class ByteArrayDocument extends AbstractDocument implements Seria /** * Creates a {@link ByteArrayDocument} which the document id, content, CAS value, expiration time and status code. - * + *

* This factory method is normally only called within the client library when a response is analyzed and a document * is returned which is enriched with the status code. It does not make sense to pre populate the status field from * the user level code. * - * @param id the per-bucket unique document id. + * @param id the per-bucket unique document id. * @param content the content of the document. - * @param cas the CAS (compare and swap) value for optimistic concurrency. - * @param expiry the expiration time of the document. + * @param cas the CAS (compare and swap) value for optimistic concurrency. + * @param expiry the expiration time of the document. * @return a {@link ByteArrayDocument}. */ public static ByteArrayDocument create(String id, int expiry, byte[] content, long cas) { @@ -101,26 +102,27 @@ public class ByteArrayDocument extends AbstractDocument implements Seria /** * Creates a {@link ByteArrayDocument} which the document id, content, CAS value, expiration time and status code. - * + *

* This factory method is normally only called within the client library when a response is analyzed and a document * is returned which is enriched with the status code. It does not make sense to pre populate the status field from * the user level code. * - * @param id the per-bucket unique document id. + * @param id the per-bucket unique document id. * @param content the content of the document. - * @param cas the CAS (compare and swap) value for optimistic concurrency. - * @param expiry the expiration time of the document. + * @param cas the CAS (compare and swap) value for optimistic concurrency. + * @param expiry the expiration time of the document. * @return a {@link ByteArrayDocument}. */ - public static ByteArrayDocument create(String id, int expiry, byte[] content, long cas, MutationToken mutationToken) { + public static ByteArrayDocument create(String id, int expiry, byte[] content, long cas, + MutationToken mutationToken) { return new ByteArrayDocument(id, expiry, content, cas, mutationToken); } /** * Creates a copy from a different {@link ByteArrayDocument}, but changes the document ID and content. * - * @param doc the original {@link ByteArrayDocument} to copy. - * @param id the per-bucket unique document id. + * @param doc the original {@link ByteArrayDocument} to copy. + * @param id the per-bucket unique document id. * @param content the content of the document. * @return a copied {@link ByteArrayDocument} with the changed properties. */ @@ -142,10 +144,10 @@ public class ByteArrayDocument extends AbstractDocument implements Seria /** * Private constructor which is called by the static factory methods eventually. * - * @param id the per-bucket unique document id. + * @param id the per-bucket unique document id. * @param content the content of the document. - * @param cas the CAS (compare and swap) value for optimistic concurrency. - * @param expiry the expiration time of the document. + * @param cas the CAS (compare and swap) value for optimistic concurrency. + * @param expiry the expiration time of the document. */ private ByteArrayDocument(String id, int expiry, byte[] content, long cas, MutationToken mutationToken) { super(id, expiry, content, cas, mutationToken);
